title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
xwiki-bridge - (01:30): [Lady Serena Kitty] seems I can't edit my groups anymore  
xwiki-bridge - (01:36): [sdumitriu] You've been a bad Kitty? :p  
xwiki-bridge - (01:37): [Lady Serena Kitty] nuuu  
xwiki-bridge - (01:38): [Lady Serena Kitty] but when I go to edit a group, I change the dropdown from "Local" to "Global" and my javascript console says "Uncaught ReferenceError: changeWiki is not defined"  
xwiki-bridge - (01:38): [Lady Serena Kitty] XWikiAllGroup:300  
xwiki-bridge - (01:38): [sdumitriu] Ah, yes  
xwiki-bridge - (01:39): [sdumitriu] It's known  
xwiki-bridge - (01:39): [Lady Serena Kitty] osh  
xwiki-bridge - (01:39): [Lady Serena Kitty] \*ohs  
xwiki-bridge - (02:18): \* sdumitriu has set the subject to: XWiki Chat - http://www.xwiki.org/  
CalebJamesDeLisl left at 02:40 (  
plunden joined #xwiki at 08:49  
CalebJamesDeLisl joined #xwiki at 09:08  
lucaa1 left at 09:12 ("Leaving."  
arkub joined #xwiki at 09:52  
KermitTheFragger joined #xwiki at 10:09  
xwiki-bridge left at 11:06 (Remote closed the connection  
xwiki-bridge joined #xwiki at 11:07  
xwiki-bridge - (11:07): \* sdumitriu has set the subject to: XWiki Chat - http://www.xwiki.org/  
kibahop joined #xwiki at 11:37  
xwiki-bridge - (12:37): [Jérôme Velociter] hi all  
xwiki-bridge - (12:38): [Jérôme Velociter] someone knows when 2.2M1 release will happen ?  
xwiki-bridge - (12:40): [glerouge] I think nobody really knows  
xwiki-bridge - (12:41): [glerouge] JV, ThomasM & Vincent are on holiday  
kibahop left #xwiki at 13:50  
sunny\_slls joined #xwiki at 14:04  
sunny\_slls - (14:09): hello everybody  
sunny\_slls - (14:10): hi arkub  
arkub - (14:11): hey sunny\_slls !!  
arkub - (14:11): how are you?  
sunny\_slls - (14:13): arkub:   
sunny\_slls - (14:13): arkub: i am fine  
sunny\_slls - (14:13): arkub: i am a final year computer science student  
sunny\_slls - (14:15): arkub: my area of interest in core java,servlet,javascript  
sunny\_slls - (14:19): arkub: i would like to enroll for GSoC this year  
arkub - (14:19): sunny\_slls: fine, you should contact the xwiki dev team then  
sunny\_slls - (14:20): which channel  
sunny\_slls - (14:20): ?  
sunny\_slls - (14:20): arkub: ??  
arkub - (14:21): sunny\_slls: this channel, but members of the core team (I'm not working for XWiki)  
sunny\_slls - (14:21): what is the mail id of jerome velocitor  
sunny\_slls - (14:21): ?  
sunny\_slls - (14:21): whom can i consult to then?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:21): [glerouge] sunny\_slls: you're in the right place  
xwiki-bridge - (14:21): [glerouge] however the next GSoC is, well, next summer  
xwiki-bridge - (14:22): [glerouge] we don't even know yet if XWiki will be selected  
xwiki-bridge - (14:22): [glerouge] and we haven't decided which projects to propose  
sunny\_slls - (14:22): xwiki-bridge: i would like to contribute  
xwiki-bridge - (14:22): [glerouge] thus it's a bit early to enroll  
sunny\_slls - (14:22): that is to be decided later  
sunny\_slls - (14:23): xwiki-bridge: i would like to contribute and show that i can code   
xwiki-bridge - (14:23): [glerouge] ok  
xwiki-bridge - (14:23): [glerouge] do you know what you'd like to contribute on ?  
sunny\_slls - (14:23): xwiki-bridge: i like visualisations  
sunny\_slls - (14:23): and i know core java,servlet and javascript  
xwiki-bridge - (14:23): [glerouge] the best way would be for you to subscribe to the [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection) mailing list and send an email presenting yourself and what you'd like to do  
xwiki-bridge - (14:24): [glerouge] what do you know about XWiki at this stage ?  
sunny\_slls - (14:24): it is a platform which creates many applications  
xwiki-bridge - (14:25): [Jérôme Velociter] sunny\_slls I'm jerome   
sunny\_slls - (14:25): xwiki-bridge: wow~!  
xwiki-bridge - (14:25): [Jérôme Velociter] :)  
sunny\_slls - (14:25): xwiki-bridge: i mailed you  
sunny\_slls - (14:25): did you receive it  
sunny\_slls - (14:25): ?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:26): [glerouge] it's a platform that allows you to write applications, applications don't get written by themselves ;)  
sunny\_slls - (14:26): xwiki-bridge: ya that is what i was telling  
sunny\_slls - (14:26): :)  
sunny\_slls - (14:26): mainly on xwiki  
xwiki-bridge - (14:26): [Jérôme Velociter] sunny\_slls yes i received it  
sunny\_slls - (14:26): sorry wiki  
xwiki-bridge - (14:26): [Jérôme Velociter] did not have time to answer you yet  
sunny\_slls - (14:27): the project that attracted me is wiki activity gadegts  
sunny\_slls - (14:28): xwiki-bridge: but where do i start from??  
sunny\_slls - (14:29): xwiki-bridge: ?  
sunny\_slls - (14:29): xwiki-bridge: are you there?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:30): [glerouge] yes  
xwiki-bridge - (14:30): [glerouge] as I said, you send an email to [[email protected]](https://dev.xwiki.org/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection)  
xwiki-bridge - (14:30): [glerouge] presenting yourself and your ideas  
sunny\_slls - (14:32): xwiki-bridge: well i don't have any strong idea to present  
sunny\_slls - (14:33): xwiki-bridge: i am new to xwiki  
xwiki-bridge - (14:33): [glerouge] how do you expect us to help you if you don't know what you want to do? ;)  
sunny\_slls - (14:33): xwiki-bridge: well how do i start with ?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:34): [glerouge] you install xwiki locally, you try following the FAQ application tutorial, write a simple application  
sunny\_slls - (14:34): what are the things which should be known to contribute to xwiki  
sunny\_slls - (14:34): ok  
xwiki-bridge - (14:34): [glerouge] you look at the contributing section on dev.xwiki.org  
sunny\_slls - (14:34): and what are the languages i need to learn for xwiki?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:35): [glerouge] Java, velocity, groovy, html, css, javascript  
sunny\_slls - (14:35): well i am aware only of java and javascript  
sunny\_slls - (14:36): and little bit of html  
xwiki-bridge - (14:41): [glerouge] sunny\_slls : velocity is easy to learn  
sunny\_slls - (14:41): xwiki-bridge: ok so my first step would be to install xwiki on my system  
sunny\_slls - (14:42): and go through the code of xwiki  
sunny\_slls - (14:43): or should i go for lanugage and learn velocity and groovy and css  
sunny\_slls - (14:43): ??  
sunny\_slls - (14:45): xwiki-bridge: please bear with me , i am an ameteur coder   
xwiki-bridge - (14:46): [glerouge] yes, that would be a good start  
xwiki-bridge - (14:46): [glerouge] good luc  
xwiki-bridge - (14:46): [glerouge] k  
sunny\_slls - (14:49): xwiki-bridge: which one? to learn velocity or install xwiki  
sunny\_slls - (14:49): xwiki-bridge: ?  
sunny\_slls - (14:52): xwiki-bridge: ?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:53): [glerouge] install xwiki  
sunny\_slls - (14:56): xwiki-bridge: i use fedora and ubuntu   
sunny\_slls - (14:57): xwiki-bridge: is this one applicable for fedora http://forge.objectweb.org/project/download.php?group\_id=170&file\_id=14171  
sunny\_slls - (14:57): xwiki-bridge: ?  
xwiki-bridge - (14:59): [glerouge] the .zip version works for Fedora  
plunden left #xwiki at 15:01  
sunny\_slls - (15:01): ok  
sunny\_slls - (15:01): xwiki-bridge: thanks a lot  
sunny\_slls - (15:11): i can code j2ee programs in windows as taught in college how to do it in fedora or ubuntu as in windows the format was foldername->WEB-INF->classes->program.java  how can we do this in fedora  
sunny\_slls - (15:13): xwiki-bridge: i googled it but didn't get it  
sunny\_slls - (15:16): arkub: can you help in this?  
sunny\_slls - (15:17): or else i have to go for windows which i don't like  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:17): I run Fedora9, and I can run XWiki under jetty with Postgres.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:17): I don't think it's any different than windows.  
sunny\_slls - (15:18): can i install xwiki using comand line  yum install xwiki?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:19): I wish :) (I had thought about making an rpm package so you could do that but it would take time)  
sunny\_slls - (15:20): oops~!  
sunny\_slls - (15:20): CalebJamesDeLisl: i don't have jetty installed   
sunny\_slls - (15:21): well can you explain the above problem  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:21): Basically what you do is install jetty and postgres or mysql (with yum) then download the .war file and unzip it (it's really a zip file) and put the contents in a folder like jetty/webapps/xwiki  
sunny\_slls - (15:21): CalebJamesDeLisl: i can code j2ee programs in windows as taught in college how to do it in fedora or ubuntu as in windows the format was foldername->WEB-INF->classes->program.java  how can we do this in fedora  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:23): Are you familiar with the subversion version control program? (you can also get this with yum)  
sunny\_slls - (15:24): cvs?  
xwiki-bridge - (15:24): [anamarias] sunny\_slls : you can download the xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb <http://forge.objectweb.org/project/download.php?group\_id=170&file\_id=14080> and you won't have to install anything else (no jetty or database) from http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/Download (they come in the package)  
xwiki-bridge - (15:24): [anamarias] you unzip it and all you do is call ./start\_xwiki.sh  
sunny\_slls - (15:25): ok  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:27): If you want to read the core code for XWiki, you can find out how to get hold of that here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/SourceRepository (that's where subversion comes in)  If you just want to run it, then what anamarias said.  
sunny\_slls - (15:28): CalebJamesDeLisl: ok thanks  
sunny\_slls - (15:28): CalebJamesDeLisl: but give me a min ..let me switch on to fedora .i am in ubuntu now  
sunny\_slls left at 15:34 ("Konversation terminated!"  
xwiki-bridge - (15:48): [Jérôme Velociter] nobody for 2.2m1 release date?   
sunny\_slls joined #xwiki at 15:49  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:51): Got fedora running?  
sunny\_slls - (15:52): CalebJamesDeLisl: yes  
sunny\_slls - (15:53): CalebJamesDeLisl: i have jetty in my services  
sunny\_slls - (15:53): but its dead  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:54): Now do you want to run XWiki on top of postgres/mysql or do you actually want to read/build the core code?  
sunny\_slls - (15:54): CalebJamesDeLisl: i would like to start from the beginning  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:54): Keep in mind that you can write script applications for XWiki without ever reading the core.  
sunny\_slls - (15:55): ok  
sunny\_slls - (15:55): i have seen that visualisations are also a part of xwiki  
sunny\_slls - (15:55): i have interest on Gui and visuals   
sunny\_slls - (15:56): can i work on it?  
sunny\_slls - (15:56): any areas provided  
sunny\_slls - (15:56): ??  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:56): I think everybody should have the experience of setting up the system with a database (like a real system admin)  
sunny\_slls - (15:56): ya that is necessary  
sunny\_slls - (15:57): so according to you where should i start with  
sunny\_slls - (15:57): ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:57): You can get around it by using the pre-bundled version but I think it's good to see how it works, understand security implications etc.  
sunny\_slls - (15:57): ok  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:58): If you want to work on user interface, most of what you do will not require compiling the source so you can use a war file  
sunny\_slls - (15:59): what are the things required to develop the user interface  
sunny\_slls - (15:59): ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:59): Velocity scripting language, CSS, HTML, Groovy scripting (Sometimes)  
sunny\_slls - (15:59): ok  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (15:59): Javascript  
sunny\_slls - (16:00): ok  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:00): I guess you start (If you don't want to use a pre bundled setup) with choosing a database.  
sunny\_slls - (16:00): just a min a call from home  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:01): just say "Caleb" and I get a pop-up message.  
sunny\_slls - (16:01): ok  
sunny\_slls - (16:01): i would like to go for mysql  
sunny\_slls - (16:09): sorry, i was attending a call from home  
sunny\_slls - (16:10): CalebJamesDeLisl: so for user interface i need to download the war file and study it   right??  
sunny\_slls - (16:11): CalebJamesDeLisl: and for core development i need to download the zip file and install  
sunny\_slls - (16:11): right?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:11): No, you just need to download it and get it running, then you can hack away at user interface freely.  
sunny\_slls - (16:11): the war file?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:11): For the core code, you will have to download the source code (which is different) and then compile it using Maven2  
sunny\_slls - (16:12): CalebJamesDeLisl: can i use mysql database  
sunny\_slls - (16:12): ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:12): Sure.  
sunny\_slls - (16:12): ok i have it  
sunny\_slls - (16:13): CalebJamesDeLisl: sorry i have a limited internet package and don't have much MB letf to dowload the file  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:15): Satellite?  
sunny\_slls - (16:15): nope  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:15): Warner cable?  
sunny\_slls - (16:15): yup  
sunny\_slls - (16:15): i have limited uploading and downloading package  
sunny\_slls - (16:16): and i have just 30mbs left  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:16): So sorry.  
sunny\_slls - (16:16): CalebJamesDeLisl: why are you being sorry  
sunny\_slls - (16:17): CalebJamesDeLisl: ok let me try on the interface part  
sunny\_slls - (16:17): CalebJamesDeLisl: i need to work on html,css and velocity  
sunny\_slls - (16:17): i have a passion for developing ui and visuals  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:18): You have to download a copy of XWiki to run locally just to work on the ui and they are all about 70Mb  
sunny\_slls - (16:18): by i would like to stick to the core part which is essential  
sunny\_slls - (16:18): CalebJamesDeLisl: i don't have that much also :(  
sunny\_slls - (16:19): by the time let me work on the scripting languages  
sunny\_slls - (16:19): CalebJamesDeLisl: i will report to you on 2 jan  
sunny\_slls - (16:19): CalebJamesDeLisl: is it ok?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:20): In the mean time there is some good reading on how the installation process works http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Installation  
sunny\_slls - (16:21): CalebJamesDeLisl: ok  
sunny\_slls - (16:21): CalebJamesDeLisl: see you later  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:21): And here's some info about scripting: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/DevGuide/Scripting  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:21): hang on, I will get you the API javadoc link.  
sunny\_slls - (16:21): ok  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:22): Here is the public api which is available to you when you are scripting: http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/download/DevGuide/API/xwiki-core-2.1.1-javadoc.jar/index.html  
sunny\_slls left at 16:24 (Read error: 54 (Connection reset by peer)  
sunny\_slls joined #xwiki at 16:26  
sunny\_slls - (16:27):  ok, i will read these docs and report to you on 2nd jan  
sunny\_slls - (16:27): CalebJamesDeLisl: thanks for guiding me and providing me with valuable information CalebJamesDeLisl: and Happy new year 2010  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:28): No problem. You too.  
sunny\_slls - (16:28): CalebJamesDeLisl: see you later  
sunny\_slls - (16:28): CalebJamesDeLisl: bye  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (16:28): bye  
sunny\_slls left at 16:29 (Client Quit  
xipe left at 16:35 (Read error: 104 (Connection reset by peer)  
xipe joined #xwiki at 16:43

arkub left at 19:17 (Read error: 113 (No route to host)

vmassol left at 19:52 (Client Quit

SvenDowideit joined #xwiki at 19:59  
xwiki-bridge - (22:57): [Lady Serena Kitty] :D  
lucaa joined #xwiki at 22:58
